description: Pumpkin Pie Overnight Oats are a simple and tasty way to enjoy the cozy flavors of pumpkin pie without baking a whole dessert.
ingredients: [{"name": "rolled oats", "units": "cup", "amount": "½"}, {"name": "milk", "units": "cup", "amount": "½"}, {"name": "canned pumpkin puree", "units": "cup", "amount": "¼"}, {"name": "chia seeds", "units": "tbsp", "amount": "1"}, {"name": "maple syrup or honey", "units": "tbsp", "amount": "1"}, {"name": "pumpkin pie spice", "units": "tsp", "amount": "½"}, {"name": "vanilla extract", "units": "tsp", "amount": "¼"}, {"name": "salt", "units": null, "amount": "pinch"}, {"name": "whipped cream or coconut whipped cream", "units": null, "amount": null}, {"name": "chopped pecans or walnuts", "units": null, "amount": null}, {"name": "ground cinnamon", "units": null, "amount": null}]
instructions: 1. In a bowl or jar, add the rolled oats, milk, pumpkin puree, chia seeds, maple syrup, pumpkin pie spice, vanilla extract, and a pinch of salt. Stir everything together until well combined, making sure all the oats are coated. 2. Cover your bowl or jar with a lid or plastic wrap and place it in the refrigerator. Let the mixture soak for at least 4 hours, or overnight, so the oats absorb the liquids and become creamy. 3. In the morning, give the oats a good stir. If it feels too thick, add a splash of milk and stir again. Spoon the oats into your serving bowls or glasses. Top with a dollop of whipped cream, sprinkle chopped nuts on top, and finish with a light dusting of cinnamon. Enjoy your delicious pumpkin pie-flavored breakfast!
notes: Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 3 days. Stir before eating and add a splash of milk if the oats have thickened.
